page.title: 12ST. ANDREW'S CHURCH KIRKELLA
page.content: Vicar The Rev.Canon J.C.H. Wilson M.A. ,Hon.C.F. The 1st definite mention of the church was in 1085 in the original Domesday Book;although a Saxon church probably existed long before.The church was part of the manor of the Norman Knight Gilbert Tison.His son William granted the church and its lands to the Abbot of Selby. The oldest part of the church remaining is the chancel which was built in the 13th century. The tower which dominates the present day village centre was built in 1450-4 and 3 bells hung which still remain . Much of the late 18th and early 19th century work was paid for by the Sykes family who had bought the manor in 1783.In the 1960's and 1970's much repair work was carried out to the organ,the tower and bells and pews.
